title: Unvaccinated man denied heart transplant by Boston hospital
description: The 31-year-old father-of-two refuses to get the shot, but the hospital says it is following policy.

title: Ros Atkins on... Investigating No 10 parties
description: Police are investigating multiple events to see if Covid rules were broken. Here's how we got to this point.

title: London bus crash: Children injured as double-decker hits shop
description: Mayor of London Sadiq Khan said his thoughts were with those affected by the "terrible incident".

title: Holiday bookings jump as Covid travel tests axed
description: Jet2 says bookings increased by 30% after it was announced test rules would be relaxed.

title: Gray report delayed as police begin No 10 parties probe
description: Met Police Commissioner Cressida Dick says the force will look into "potential breaches of Covid-19 regulations".

title: Ukraine: 'I should be ready to defend the country'
description: Marta is getting military training to prepare for a possible Russian invasion but says she doesn't want war.

title: Marmite maker Unilever to cut 1,500 jobs worldwide
description: Unilever, which also makes Dove soap and PG Tips, will axe the roles in more than 100 countries.

title: Tyson Fury 'sick of listening to excuses' of Anthony Joshua and Dillian Whyte
description: Tyson Fury is calling for a decision to be made on his next fight, saying he is "sick of listening" to the excuses of Anthony Joshua and Dillian Whyte.

title: Ukraine: How will we know if war has started?
description: Speculation is rife about when Putin might strike but maybe hostilities already started, writes Jonathan Marcus.

title: British bride's 1930s wedding dress saved from Australian rubbish skip
description: A silk dress destined for the dump is snapped up by another bride-to-be 84 years after it was worn.

title: Ukraine: US troops on alert as West voices unity
description: Western allies agree to sanctions against Russia if it invades, as thousands of troops stand by.

title: Africa Cup of Nations: At least eight killed in crush at Cameroon stadium
description: Dozens more people are injured in the incident outside a football stadium in Cameroon.

title: Nadal gets 'preferential treatment' from umpires - Shapovalov complains after five-set defeat
description: Rafael Nadal and other top players are given preferential treatment by umpires, says Canada's Denis Shapovalov after his quarter-final loss to the Spaniard in Melbourne.

title: Cost of living: How oil heating price rise is worrying families
description: More than 1.5 million UK householders rely on oil for heating, with some seeing 50% price rises.

title: Barty races past Pegula to set up semi-final with Keys
description: Ashleigh Barty underlines why she is the Australian Open favourite as she thrashes Jessica Pegula to set up a semi-final against Madison Keys.

title: Cardi B awarded almost £1m in damages in defamation case win
description: A court heard the rapper was subjected to a "malicious campaign" by YouTuber Latasha Kebe.

title: Inflation surge sends UK interest payments higher
description: The amount of interest paid on government debt was the highest for a December on record.

title: Watford set to appoint Roy Hodgson as new manager
description: Watford are set to appoint former England boss Roy Hodgson as their new manager following the sacking of Claudio Ranieri.

title: Australian Open: Peng Shuai T-shirt ban reversed after outcry
description: The turnaround comes less than 24 hours after organisers banned the shirt for being "political".

title: Crossrail: A first journey on London’s new line
description: The Elizabeth line will run under central London.

title: The Papers: PM's lockdown 'birthday bash' and 'Nato jets ready'
description: The papers lead on the prime minister's birthday party during the first lockdown in 2020.

title: Brecon Beacons: Caver trapped for 54 hours relives survival fight
description: George Linnane feels lucky to be alive, but wants to get back to caving to help others in trouble.

title: The Beatles and John Lennon memorabilia to be sold as NFTs
description: John Lennon's eldest son Julian will keep the physical items as he sells digital versions of them.

title: What's been causing lorry queues at Dover?
description: Are new Brexit checks to blame for long queues of lorries outside Dover last week?

title: ‘They were like bandits’ - how did the rich get richer?
description: Did a Bank of England policy to save the UK economy during the financial crash make the wealthiest people even wealthier?

title: AI: Why chefs are turning to artificial intelligence
description: How a robot is being used in the highly specialised business of creating flavours.

title: Aboriginal flag: Australian government secures copyright after row
description: Aboriginal Australians say the symbol of identity was previously "held hostage" by lease agreements.

title: António Horta-Osório: The banker who can't stay out of the headlines
description: One of the UK's best-known banking bosses, António Horta-Osório is used to good - and bad - headlines.

title: Uttar Pradesh: Why deadly cow attacks are an issue in Indian state election
description: Uttar Pradesh banned cow slaughter. Now, stray cattle are destroying crops and attacking people.

title: How Covid disinformation has fuelled attacks on Czech doctors
description: Knowing how to deal with aggressive patients has become even more important during the pandemic.

title: Beijing takes to the ice as Winter Olympics approach
description: The BBC's Stephen McDonell spends a day on the ice with some local enthusiasts in Beijing.

title: Climate change threatening buried UK treasures
description: Our ability to understand Britain's history is at risk, warn archaeologists.

title: Back on the Covid wards: How is the NHS coping now?
description: Clive Myrie visits the Royal London Hospital as experts speak of "light at the end of the tunnel".
